qas.question: Who holds a majority of the shares in the Everton FC?

context: Everton F.C. is a limited company with <a0_0>the board of directors<a0_0/> holding a majority of the shares. The club's most recent accounts, from <b8_0>May<b8_0/> 2014, show a net total debt of £28.1 million, with a turnover of <b6_0><b7_0>£120.5 million<b7_0/><b6_0/> and a profit of <b5_0>£28.2<b5_0/> million. The club's overdraft with Barclays Bank is secured against the Premier League's "<a1_0>Basic Award Fund<a1_0/>", a guaranteed sum given to clubs for <a2_0>competing in the Premier League<a2_0/>. Everton agreed a long-term loan of <a3_0><b9_0>£30 million<b9_0/><a3_0/> with Bear Stearns and Prudential plc in 2002 over the duration of <a4_0>25 years<a4_0/>; a consolidation of debts at the time as well as a source of capital for new player acquisitions. Goodison Park is secured as collateral.
